intro: Neea hermaphrodita var. grandifolia, commonly known as the large-flowered neea, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. This variety is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
